alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 07 at 11:22AM CDT until April 07 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in south central Nebraska... Northern Webster County in south central Nebraska... Adams County in south central Nebraska... Kearney County in south central Nebraska... Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... Hall County in south central Nebraska... * Until 1215 PM CDT. * At 1120 AM CDT, a dust channel was near Gibbon, or 13 miles east of Kearney, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite and DOT Cameras. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Significant reductions to visibility are expected along Interstate 80 and Highway 281. * This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 264 and 317. Locations impacted include... Grand Island, Kearney, Hastings, Minden, Gibbon, Ravenna, Wood River, Shelton, Blue Hill, Kenesaw, Doniphan, Juniata, Axtell, Alda, Odessa, Campbell, Pleasanton, Amherst, Bladen and Roseland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms are unhealthy and have been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Webster
